result.execSummary:
The defendant Carol A. Buker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Controlled Substance as Ordinance. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carol A. Buker

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Carol A. Buker in court with attorney Gregory W. Sacra.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Sacra states 15CM232 has been resolved and states recs.  In 15CM214 that matter will be resolved just not today.  Requests short reset.  Bond continued in 15CM214.  Court resets 15CM214.  State moves to amend 15CM232 to Ord. 11.10 in Ct 2 only.  Court so amends.  Atty Sacra enters NC plea.  DE agrees.  Court finds DE guilty and sentences.  

15CM232
Ct 1:  Dismissed/read-in
Ct 2:  amended to THC as an ordinance 11.10
$162.70 fine/costs to be paid w/in 60 days or set up payment plan

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant Carol A. Buker in court.  Court states cases and questions DE on her petition for court-appointed counsel.  DE states she recently acquired an inheritance and was denied by public defender's office due to that.  DE states she does have access to it at this time.  Court finds DE conditionally indigent and appoints Atty Greg Sacra (322 1st Ave #1, Baraboo (608) 356-3010).  To reimburse COC's office $250.00/month beginning 8/1/2015 and then by the first of each month thereafter.

Pre-trial conference at 08-07-2015 08:45 am.
Return date at 08-18-2015 01:00 pm.

Defendant Carol A. Buker in court.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney, waived.  File set for pre-trial conference/return date.  $1,100.00 signature bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Booking today.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 08:45 am.  Return date scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Carol A. Buker
Current: 3640 13th Ave, Wisconsin Dells, WI 53965 United States  (Effective: 06-03-2015)
Prior: 1650 North Dewey Ave, # 21, Reedsburg, WI 53959

Defendant Carol A. Buker not in court.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State notes the signed bond in their file shows tomorrow as the return date.  Also states DE is under supervision of IL DHS and they say she won't be here.  Court sets out w/summons date.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
